div.p:
It affords me much pleasure, dear Mr Fletcher, to introduce to you Mr Homeyer, a Gentleman, who was educated as a Horticulturist at one of the best school for Gardening in Prussia. Mr Homeyer is anxious to obtain the Curatorship of your public garden, and I feel convinced that, if the Sandhurst
Now Bendigo, Vic. Council will entrust to him the Administration of its Gardenground, you will gain the services of a zealous and enlightened man.
